This should no longer cause the editor to "crash", but it still won't produce a
nice output. It will put up a messagebox saying NPE occured and it will have an
empty graphical editor. Though you can still use the text editor portion. We
can't do much more than this because we're not supposed to get NPE's in our
code, so this is the cleanest way of handling it.

As for what caused the actual NPE, the only way this could occur is if read
method that the property was pointing to was no longer in the model. This
shouldn't of occured except in a rare race condition, where the JavaModel was
being refreshed at the same time we were doing this instantiate, so we grabbed a
Method from the model, and then by the time we wanted to use it the Method had
gone stale. We need to address this whole refresh scenario now that we are
multi-threaded.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 55431 ***
